description.narrative: The Justice , Development and Peace Committee is an national NGO in Nigeria. Active in various Archdioceses in a number of States. The Integrated Development Programme seeks to improve the economic and social status, ensure food security and access to social facilities for improved rural livelihood among participating farmers in Ibadan Archdiocese. Our beneficiariesare subsistence farmers; men, women youths and the underserved within the archdiocese irrespective of religious believe and affiliation. They are offered capacity building on sustaining agriculturalpractices, promotion of group marketing initiatives, strategic lobby, advocacy, Networking and linkages. The integrated development programme covers both the rainforest zone and the derived savannah areas of the archdiocese. In the derived savannah area,wework in Igangan 3 local government areas in Oyo state # Ibarapa north, Ibarapa East and Ido LGAs and Ayedaade and Irewole LGAs of Osun state. Justice, Development and Peace Committee-Parish operates within a particular Parish from the grass-root level. In this pilot project the program team is responsable for identifying fish farmers communities who can participate in the pilot, building confidence, get them motivated, participate in the trainings and capacity building activities for better management practices, help farmers to get better organised, assist in monitoring and evaluation of activities.

participating-org.narrative:
The Democracy and Human Rights Programme is created to achieve the goal of contributing to a system of Inclusive governance process, where accountability, transparency and respect for human rights prevail in Oyo State. This programme is implemented in 28Local Government Areas; 22 in Oyo State and 6 in Osun State. The programe has two components; Democracy and Governance and Human Rights. Democracy and Governance is concerned with political re-awakening of the citizens for popular participation in politics and monitoring the democratic process in the state and nationally. Human Rights is concerned with providing legal aid and alternative dispute resolution services, promoting and enforcing human rights of the indigent members of society and inmates of theprison. The objectives of this programme are:To see that Justices of the Peace are working effectively in an enabling environment; Police Community Relations on issues of human rights will be strengthened; the right of awaiting trial persons in Agodi Prison to fair hearing is guaranteed; Civil Coalition for Good Governance (CCGG) operational capacity is enhanced; articulated needs of the constituencies are reflected in government projects in Oyo State; infrastructural decay, human rights abuses are identified, exposed through electronic media and addressed by government.
The Integrated Development Programme seeks to improve the economic and social status, ensure food security and access to social facilities for improved rural livelihood among participating farmers in Ibadan Archdiocese. Our beneficiaries are subsistence farmers; men, women youths and the underserved within the archdiocese irrespective of religious believe and affiliation. They are offered capacity building on sustaining agriculturalpractices, promotion of group marketing initiatives, strategic lobby, advocacy, Networking and linkages. The integrated development programme covers both the rainforest zone and the derived savannah areas of the archdiocese. In the derived savannah area,wework in Igangan 3 local government areas in Oyo state # Ibarapa north, Ibarapa East and Ido LGAs and Ayedaade and Irewole LGAs of Osun state.
The Women Development Child Rights Programme is concerned with promotion of the welfare of children and women especially the most vulnerable among them in our immediate environments with particular attention to 20 Local Government Areas in Oyo and some parts of Osun State, South West Nigeria. The Programme upholds children andwomen#s right to health, security and physical integrity, the right to be free from torture and cruel, inhuman or degrading treatment, and the right to life. Our objective is to; facilitate the enforcement of the child rights acts for reduction of the incidence of child trafficking/labour in our immediate environment and sensitize the public on the adverse effects of these practices using themedia, street rallies and enlightenment workshops; create public enlightenment on the dangers of FGM and facilitate opportunities and access to expert counselling for FGM victims; network and collaborate with partners in relevant fields to facilitate and contribute to and enhance the chances of success in the projects# implementation.
Community Service Punishment Programme seeks to reform the criminal justice system in Oyo and Ogun States by advocating for a Bill for the use of community service punishment for minor offences to decongest the prisons, as well as to make reintegration of offenders into the society more achievable. The programme will also see to the implementation, management and Administration of the Community service law and scheme by ensuring that: the judiciary understands and applies community service sentencing for minor offences; aggrieved groups and individuals believe and accept community service punishment as satisfactory justice; the public is better aware and participate in chain monitoring of community service punishment gratefully.
The Caritas desk Ibadan is the Humanitarian and emergency response unit of the organization. It advocates peaceful coexistence of all by administering peace education to youths and establishing peace clubs in secondary schools in Oyo and Osun states; it pursues improved living conditions and physical, spiritual and social wellbeing of theinmates in Agodi prison; providesa platform for testing and counseling of people living with HIV/AIDS, Orphans and Vulnerable Children through her support group.
Justice, Development and Peace Committee-Parish operates within a particular Parish fromthegrass-root level. JDPC-Parish aims at imparting the Social Teaching of the Church to the parishioners and the members of different institutions or formation houses which are situated in those parishes in order to help them identify injustices or unjust restructures within their vicinities or raise awareness of the existing injustices such as modern slavery in terms of Child Trafficking and Labour, Female Genital Mutilation (FGM), Sexual abuse, widows# exploitation and harassment, violation of human rights, workers/farmers exploitation, conflicts and insecurity, unemployment or the vulnerable, just to mention but a few! Having identified the injustices, JDPC-Parish members in collaboration withJDPC Headquarters address the issue(s) at hand promptly,adequately and accordingly. Thus, JDPC-Parish is a prophetic voice of the voiceless within a parish, though its voice echoes beyond parish level as it embraces not only Catholics but also non-Catholics living within a particular parish territory
